#summary Resources for robust morphological tagging.

== Introduction ==

On this page you can find resources related to our work on robust morphological tagging.

== Resources ==

 * [marlin MarLiN] a fast word clustering tool.
 * [http://cistern.cis.lmu.de/marmot/naacl2015/naacl2015_dict.tar.bz2 Word representations] (morphological dictionaries and word clusterings)
 * Tokenized and tagged Wikipedia dumps:
  * [http://cistern.cis.lmu.de/marmot/naacl2015/cs.wikidump.bz2 Czech]
  * [http://cistern.cis.lmu.de/marmot/naacl2015/en.wikidump.bz2 English]
  * [http://cistern.cis.lmu.de/marmot/naacl2015/de.wikidump.bz2 German]
  * [http://cistern.cis.lmu.de/marmot/naacl2015/hu.wikidump.bz2 Hungarian]
  * [http://cistern.cis.lmu.de/marmot/naacl2015/la.wikidump.bz2 Latin]
  * [http://cistern.cis.lmu.de/marmot/naacl2015/es.wikidump.bz2 Spanish]
 * A manually annotated [http://cistern.cis.lmu.de/marmot/naacl2015/smultron.tar.bz2 morphological layer] for the [http://www.cl.uzh.ch/research/parallelcorpora/paralleltreebanks/smultron_en.htm SMULTRON] corpus

== Reference ==

The creation of these resources is documented in the following paper.
If you use any of these resources in your research and would like to acknowledge them, this would also be a good paper to cite.

 @InProceedings{mueller2015,
